rComments: Rubin is a great professor. He does experiments/shows videos in class which is a nice break! I STRONGLY recommend going to section AND MSI. While Rubin is a great teacher, and very helpful, he doesn't give cheat sheets on tests like other chemistry professors. Also, his grading isn't adjusted as much as the other Profs. 65% overall in the class C

Good professor who is passionate on what he's teaching. He knows what's he's doing and if you have a question will stop to answer it and explain it. Does experiments in class to explain the Chemistry. Tests can be hard, however, they tend to follow the review sheet.

Easy class. I learned more doing the homework than I did in lecture, but Seth is such a cool guy I didn't mind going. If you get stuck on the homework, then you can always rely on Seth to do a similar problem as an example in class.

Seth is a fantastic guy and a great professor he's super clear when it comes to his lectures and what he says will probably be on the midterm ends up being on the midterm. He makes he lectures enjoyable and his class goes by super quickly. His office hours are usually packed, but he'll still meet with you to get you the help you need

If you pay attention in class and make sure you know the processes of solving all the problem types he teaches, you can pass with a reasonable grade. He cares about the students and gives a practice test almost identical to the midterms right before the actual test.

Seth Rubin is very clear cut. Pretty much what you see is what you get. Tests are multiple choice and lectures included experiements and videos, which was a very nice break from chemical equations and notes. Minimal effort, you'll pass.

Rubin is super clear cut and tells you what to expect. Make sure you do the practice tests, the tests are similar to what you get. I did all the homework really quick and I'd say the homework was probably the hardest part in the class, so if you keep up with the homework you'll be solid.

Prof. Rubin I would say is the best professor I have had. To pass the class, read the section before class, study your notes, ATTEND section and most importantly attend his office hours (He is VERY funny!). He is a very fair grader and wants his students to pass. Homework is not too tough, but doing it makes you understand the concept as well!

Professor Rubin is a very approachable and fun teacher so going to his office hours was always helpful. His class can move quite fast but reading the textbook before his lectures are helpful. Also, because he's left-handed, copying every note he writes down can be difficult but he posts everything online. Exams are very fair, but homework is hard.

He is a nice and funny guy. He likes to use experiment to make clarify the material and make the class interesting. Many people say the class is hard. It is not if you read the book before you go to his lecture. And he curves the grade which makes it easier to get an A

write down everything he writes, study your notes, ask questions in class ( I asked tons) and use the book to help clarify things you didn't understand in class. Got an A, but had to work for it. He really wants you to LEARN. Dr. Rubin is amazing.

Well prepared lectures. His exams are completely fair and are on material covered in lecture. I suggest doing the assigned reading before his lecture so that you can follow along with what he is saying. Because of the subject, the material is ridiculously hard. Do not fall behind.
Probably the best class i've ever taken.

Loved this class. By far one of the best science teachers here. One point to note, he really likes using obscure examples from his power points as test questions. For instance: If he shows you a structure of a protein, say GRB2, you'd better remember exactly what it looks like for the test.
Amazing professor.super clear and always there to help you. BEST biochem professor you will have on the whole series

The class is not easy, but Seth Rubin is the greatest teacher that ever walked on this earth. Alright that's a bit much but he's a really cool guy and a good teacher. Just pay attention in class and focus on his notes and you'll do fine.

my favorite biochem series profess. exams were a lil hard but once you understand his lectures and understand what he wants from you, you will know exactly what he wants on the midterms and will pass with flying colors. STUDY LECTURES everything on the midterm is there.

very approachable and clear in what he wants you to get from the class. the subject matter takes time to understand and grasp but seth is very helpful AND TAs are a big help as well. im not a big fan of any biochem book, so i only practiced problems from the book (didnt really read it) and definitely attend class!!
Seth is a great guy. Helpful in office hours and if you ask questions after class. Class was moderately difficult but overall it was quite rewarding.
